bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

div1.p: Carter requests to know what was said at the malaria conference concerning mosquito breeding in wells and containers.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter], January 17, 1925
div1.opener:
/LC
2122 California St., N. W.,
, D. C.,
January 17, 1925.
div1.p:
Dr. Deeks writes me that several of the papers read at the
New Orleans meeting stated that wells were among the worst places
they had to deal with for the production of Anophles mosquitoes.

Hitherto I had thought that although such breeding--especial-
ly in shallow wells--was rather general, yet it was not enough to
be of sanitary importance: The same being true of artificial con-
tainers, which, however, as they might be more numerous were some-
what more under suspicion.

Please advise me as to
1/ What was said:
2/ What you know yourself.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General,
(On Waiting Orders).
